snippet: The Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx on Sunday, killing four people, was traveling nearly three times the allowable speed through a curving stretch of track, investigators said.
abstract: Federal investigators say Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx, killing four people, was traveling 82 miles per hour as it approached 30-mile-an-hour curve; say throttle was still engaged until six seconds before locomotive came to a stop after train careered off the tracks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Annie Correal, Jesse McKinley, Patrick McGeehan and William K. Rashbaum.

lead_paragraph: The Metro-North train that derailed in the Bronx on Sunday, killing four people, was traveling nearly three times the allowable speed through a curving stretch of track, investigators said.

headline.main: Metro-North Train Sped at 82 M.P.H. Ahead of Curve in Fatal Crash
headline.print_headline: Train Racing 82 M.P.H. Before Fatal Derailment
